snippet: More than 40 horsemen have agreed to turn over records for the two weeks before any graded stakes races, which will be made available to the public two hours before post time.
abstract: Some of horse racing’s most prominent owners and trainers pledge to make public the veterinary records of their horses competing in high-level stakes races, including the Kentucky Derby; offer is an effort to restore integrity and transparency to a sport recently battered by scandal.
lead_paragraph: More than 40 horsemen have agreed to turn over records for the two weeks before any graded stakes races, which will be made available to the public two hours before post time.

headline.main: Horse Owners and Trainers Say They’ll Release Veterinary Records
headline.print_headline: Vet Records to Be Made Available to Public
